poem:
Pause in Progress

Shell halts
its grand endeavor—
steel bones rise, but halt.
Waste-bound dreams of green flight
linger amid scaffolding.

Technical snares grip,
aspirations held still
by invisible webs.

In Rotterdam,
promise suspended—
a future
awaits breath.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Shell to pause construction of huge biodiesel plant in Rotterdam Shell has paused the construction of one of Europe’s largest biofuel plants which was expected to convert waste into green jet fuel and biodiesel by the end of the decade. The oil company said on Tuesday it would “temporarily pause” work on one of its biggest energy transition projects to address the technical difficulties that have delayed its progress so far.
